title: Commission Directive 89/23/EEC of 21 December 1988 amending the Annexes to Council Directive 70/524/EEC concerning additives in feedingstuffs
header:
COMMISSION  DIRECTIVE
of 21 December 1988
amending the Annexes to Council Directive 70/524/EEC concerning additives in feedingstuffs
(89/23/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Annex I to Directive 70/524/EEC is hereby amended as set out in the Annex hereto.

Member States shall, by 30 November 1990 at the latest, bring into force the laws, regulations or administrative provisions necessary to comply with Article 1. They shall immediately inform the Commission thereof.
This Directive is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 21 December 1988.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
(1) OJ No L 270, 14. 12. 1970, p. 1.
(2) OJ No L 343, 13. 12. 1988, p. 25.
(3) OJ No L 245, 12. 9. 1985, p. 1.
ANNEX
In Annex I:
1. the wording under part C 'Aromatic and appetizing substances' is replaced by the following:
1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8 //  //  //  //  //  //  //  //  // EEC No  // Additives   // Chemical formula, description   // Species or category of animal  // Maximum age   // Minimum content  // Maximum content   //  1.2.3.4.5.6,7.8 //   //   //   //  //   // mg/kg of complete feedingstuff  // Other provisions  // 1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8 //  //  //  //  //  //  //  //  //  // 'C. Aromatic substances and appetizing substances:  //  //  //  //  //  //  //  // 1. All natural products and corresponding synthetic products 2. Artificial substances:  // -   // All species or categories of animals   // -   // -  // -   // -   // E 954 (i)   // Saccharin  // C7H5NO3S  // Piglets   // Four months   // -   // 150   // -   // E 954 (ii)   // Calcium saccharin  // C7H3NCaO3S  // Piglets  // Four months   // -   // 150   // -   // E 954 (iii)  // Sodium saccharin  // C7H4NNaO3S  // Piglets   // Four months   // -   // 150   // -'   //    //   //   //   //   //  //   //
2. Under part D, 'Coccidiostats and other medicinal substances' the following item is added:
1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8 //  //  //  //  //  //  //  //  // EEC No  // Additives   // Chemical formula, description   // Species or category of animal  // Maximum age   // Minimum content  // Maximum content   //  1.2.3.4.5.6,7.8 //   //   //   //  //   // mg/kg of complete feedingstuff  // Other provisions  // 1.2.3.4.5.6.7.8 //  //  //  //  //  //  //  //  // 'E 769  // Nifursol  // 3,5-dinitro-N1-(5-nitrofurfurylidene) salicylohydrazide Minimum purity: 98 % on an anhydrous basis Particular features of the three authorized preparations: - maximum Nifursol content 14,6 %, 44 % or 50 %, - minimum stability: 24 months, - carrier for the three preparations: maize starch and respectively 12 %, 33 % or 34 % of soya bean oil  // Turkeys   // -   // 50   // 75   // Use prohibited at least five days before slaughter Maximum amount of dust emitted during handling, as determined by the Stauber Heubach method (1): 0,1 mg Nifursol
//  //  //  //  //  //  //  // (1) Literature reference: Fresenius Z., Anal. Chem. (1984) 318: 522 to 524, Springer Verlag 1984.'
